perturbation.original_text: Distributor will pay WGT for each Product Distributor orders an amount equal to WGT's then current WatchGuard Price List in effect on the date of receipt by WGT of Distributor's order, subject to the applicable discount set forth in Exhibit A. WGT may, from time to time, change its WatchGuard Price List, provided that any such change will not be effective under this Agreement unless and until the expiration of forty-five (45) days after WGT gives Distributor written notices of the change.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will pay WGT for each Product Distributor orders an amount equal to WGT's then current WatchGuard Price List in effect on the date of receipt by WGT of Distributor's order, subject to the applicable discount set forth in Exhibit A. WGT may change its WatchGuard Price List at any time and such changes shall be effective immediately upon notification to the Distributor. WGT will use reasonable efforts to provide advance notice of price changes, but immediate changes are permissible.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a 45-day waiting period for price list changes to take effect. The modified text allows for immediate price changes upon notification, creating a contradiction about the effective date of price changes, which could lead to disputes over invoiced amounts.

perturbation.original_text: WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing through resellers to return any defective Product in accordance with the limited warranty contained in the applicable end-user license agreement or limited hardware warranty, as applicable, provided that the Distributor and end-user have compiled with the applicable warranty terms and conditions. In order to receive the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor shall deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written explanation of the alleged defect within thirty (30) days from the later of Distributor's initial receipt of such Product from WGT or from the delivery of such Product to an end-user.
perturbation.changed_text: WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing through resellers to return any defective Product. The determination of whether a product is truly 'defective' will be made solely at the discretion of the Distributor, who shall then inform WGT of their decision. In order to receive the remedy provided for hereunder, Distributor shall deliver to WGT a sample of the Product which Distributor finds to be defective in workmanship or materials, or damaged in shipment prior to Distributor assuming the risk of loss or damage , along with a written explanation of the alleged defect within ninety (90) days from Distributor's initial receipt of such Product from WGT. There is no time limitation from delivery to an end-user.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to the 'limited warranty' and compliance with its terms. The modified text shifts the defect determination to the Distributor's discretion, conflicting with the original warranty's conditions. The original text indicates 30 days for reporting after the delivery to end-user. The modified text removes time limitation from delivery to an end-user and sets a specific 90 day window from WGT delivery, creating conflicting requirements for product returns.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1  Term. The Term will commence on the Effective Date of this Agreement and will remain in effect, unless sooner terminated under paragraphs 5.2, 5.3, or 5.4, until the termination date specified in Exhibit A.

The Term will automatically renew for successive additional periods of one (1) year each, provided that: (a) Distributor has made all Guaranteed Minimum Purchases and has complied with the marketing requirements under paragraph 4.1(b); (b) the parties have agreed in writing upon the Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts and Product price discounts for the next subsequent one (1) year renewal period; (c) neither party provided the other party with notice of such party's intention not to renew this Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to any year's Expiration Date; and (d) neither party provided the other party with such notice as may be required pursuant to paragraphs 5.2, 5.3 or 5.4.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1  Term. The Term will commence on the Effective Date of this Agreement and will remain in effect, unless sooner terminated under paragraphs 5.2, 5.3, or 5.4, until the termination date specified in Exhibit A.

The Term will automatically renew for successive additional periods of one (1) year each, provided that: (a) Distributor has made all Guaranteed Minimum Purchases and has complied with the marketing requirements under paragraph 4.1(b); (b) the parties have agreed in writing upon the Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts and Product price discounts for the next subsequent one (1) year renewal period; (c) either party provided the other party with notice of such party's intention not to renew this Agreement at least ninety (90) days prior to any year's Expiration Date; and (d) neither party provided the other party with such notice as may be required pursuant to paragraphs 5.2, 5.3 or 5.4.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a 30-day notice period for non-renewal, whereas the modification specifies a 90-day notice period. This contradiction regarding the required notice duration creates uncertainty regarding the proper procedure for preventing automatic renewal.
